title: I Cannot Believe These Stunning 14K White Gold Birthstone Earrings Are Down to $180 Right Now
description: Plus more beautiful jewelry picks from Blue Nile's Anniversary Sale
content:
All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, StyleCaster may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes.
• None This Brightening Eye Stick Has Even Converted Non-Believers—Grab It for 47% Off From Amazon
• None ‘Skeptical’ Shoppers Say This Snail Mucin Face Mask Vanishes Wrinkles After 2 Weeks—& It's Now Under $2
• None I Found a Discounted Baggu Crescent Bag Lookalike on Amazon & It's $24 Cheaper Than the Original

I’m big on accessories. Rings, watches, bracelets, necklaces, headbands, glasses—I love finding ways to add some shimmer, whimsy, and elevation to my daily ensemble. This means I’m constantly on the lookout for special pieces of jewelry, and I’ve especially been on the hunt for meaningful birthstone picks. It’s one of the many ways I can honor my family and be reminded of their love throughout the day.

If you, too, are looking for unique jewelry that’s designed to stand out and built to last, Blue Nile is one of my favorite spots to look—and the retailer is having a sale *right now*. Scroll on for some of my favorite pieces, including 14K white gold birthstone earrings I’m snagging as a gift for myself.

Best Birthstone Earrings: Oval Birthstone White Topaz Stud Earrings in 14K Yellow Gold, $180 (was $300)

Best Birthstone Necklace: Aquamarine Rope Pendant in Sterling Silver, $229 (was $270)

Best Layering Necklace: 18″ Cable Chain in 14k Yellow Gold, $252 (was $420)

Best Bracelet: Petite Oval Multicolor Gemstone Bracelet in Sterling Silver, $161 (was $190)

Best Simple Wedding Ring: Classic Wedding Ring in Platinum, $315 (was $450)

Best Hoop Earrings: Multicolored Gemstone Hoop Earrings In Sterling Silver, $192 (was $310)

Best Knot Earrings: Love Knot Earrings in Italian Sterling Silver, $76 (was $90)

Best Pearls: Freshwater Cultured Pearl Strand With 14K Yellow Gold, $252 (was $420)

Our mission at STYLECASTER is to bring style to the people, and we only feature products we think you’ll love as much as we do. Blue Nile is a STYLECASTER sponsor, however, all products in this article were independently selected by our editors. Please note that if you purchase something by clicking on a link within this story, we may receive a small commission of the sale.

Right now, Blue Nile is celebrating its 26th anniversary with its biggest sale of the year. From now through September 15, you can get up to 40 percent off select jewelry pieces, 25 percent off all engagement ring settings, and 30 percent off lab-grown diamonds.

Shop my favorite picks below, all of which are under $500.

Our Favorite Picks from the Blue Nile Anniversary Sale

I’m constantly looking for sweet and subtle birthstone jewelry that I can put on and keep on without constantly switching out. I’m lazy, and my ears are sensitive, so this means I need either gold or sterling silver jewelry (nothing just plated!). These earrings fit the bill, and their oval shape is so pretty and unexpected. The size of the gem is ideal for that pop of shimmer I’m always looking for.

Metal Type: 14K white gold, 14K yellow gold

Gemstone Type: all birthstones, but they vary by price

Colorful gemstones are one of the most popular 2024 jewelry trends, and these hoop earrings are a fun, subtle way to incorporate them into your accessories look. The hoop earrings are slightly larger than huggie hoops and are designed in sterling silver with round multicolored gemstones — aka, amethyst, peridot, blue topaz, and citrine — for a touch of shimmering sparkle.

Pearls are having a bit of a moment right now, too, and you can’t go wrong with a classic Pearl Strand. This one from Blue Nile is 24 inches long and features 85 freshwater cultured pearls, strung together with a 14K yellow or white gold clasp. The pearl necklace also comes in different diameters so, depending on your style preference, you can go with 6, 7, 7.5, 8, or 9.5 mm pearls.

Technically this is a wedding ring, but a jewelry hack of mine is shopping wedding rings on sale and wearing them as everyday pieces. They’re typically sturdier, and this platinum one is meant for longer wear. Especially if you prefer “wear it and forget it” jewelry, this ring is ultra lightweight, so you can truly wear it every day without noticing.

Maybe it’s because I’m a 13-year-old at heart, but I love a colorful, summer camp-inspired bracelet. I especially love to stack it and mix it with other metals, like yellow gold and sterling silver. Mismatched is the way to go this year, and this multicolor gemstone bracelet is one way to achieve that look.

This is the ultimate layering necklace that every woman needs. Whether you like to rock charms or simple name plates, pairing everything with a simple gold or silver chain enhances the look. This 18” chain necklace is the perfect length, and while it is dainty, it’s well-crafted and built to last.

Metal Type: 14k yellow gold (but comes in others)

Gemstone Type: N/A

These knot earrings give your ensemble a subtle nautical twist without being too flashy. I’d go for these instead of a standard stud earring, since they’re simple but elevated.

Another pretty gemstone find, this aquamarine pendant necklace has stunning features like a rope-like setting and a thick sterling silver chain that is sure to stand out. Layer it with other pieces, or wear it on its own.
• None I'm a Stylist Who Lives in New York & These Are the Warmest Winter Coats, Hands Down
• None 7 Vintage-Inspired Jeans That Lift Your Bum But Are Actually Comfortable
• None I’m Obsessed With This Go-With-Everything Dress That's $37 on Amazon For a Limited Time

Sign up for Stylecaster's Newsletter. For the latest news, follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.
summary: Blue Nile is celebrating its 26th anniversary with its biggest sale of the year, offering up to 40 percent off select jewelry pieces, 25 percent off all engagement ring settings, and 30 percent off lab-grown diamonds. The retailer is also offering discounts on select 14K white gold birthstone earrings. All products and services featured are independently chosen by StyleCaster editors and may result in a commission on orders placed through its retail links. The article also includes a review of a discounted Baggu Crescent Bag Lookalike on Amazon for $24.
shortSummary: Blue Nile’s biggest sale of the year, featuring up to 40% discounts on various pieces of jewelry, includes 14K White Gold Birthstone Earrings for $180.

argos_summary: Blue Nile is currently celebrating its 26th anniversary with significant discounts on various jewelry pieces, offering up to 40% off select items, 25% off engagement ring settings, and 30% off lab-grown diamonds. The article highlights several favorite jewelry picks, including birthstone earrings, necklaces, and bracelets, emphasizing their quality and unique designs. The featured items are crafted from durable materials like gold and sterling silver, making them suitable for everyday wear.
